unnormalised: The buzz around town is all about the new RBI guidelines! Apparently, they're cracking down on the use of multiple IFSC codes per branch. Remember how Axis Bank's Nariman Point branch had, like, 5 different IFSCs (AXIS0000001, AXIS0000002, etc.)? Well, those days are ending, bhai! They're saying each branch needs to consolidate to a single, primary code.
normalised: The buzz around town is all about the new R-B-I guidelines! Apparently, they're cracking down on the use of multiple I-F-S-C codes per branch. Remember how Axis Bank's Nariman Point branch had, like, five different I-F-S-Cs (A-X-I-S zero zero zero zero zero zero one, A-X-I-S zero zero zero zero zero zero two, etcetera)? Well, those days are ending, bhai! They're saying each branch needs to consolidate to a single, primary code.

unnormalised: Apparently, this is all about streamlining things and reducing fraud. Makes sense, right? Too many codes floating around, and things get messy. Now, customers need to make sure they're using the right, updated IFSC. Imagine sending money to your cousin and it bounces because you used the old code – total headache! Details are emerging and many account holders are wondering what they need to do with their existing linked accounts, especially those with MICR numbers like 400210541.
normalised: Apparently, this is all about streamlining things and reducing fraud. Makes sense, right? Too many codes floating around, and things get messy. Now, customers need to make sure they're using the right, updated I-F-S-C. Imagine sending money to your cousin and it bounces because you used the old code – total headache! Details are emerging and many account holders are wondering what they need to do with their existing linked accounts, especially those with M-I-C-R numbers like four hundred two thousand one hundred and five thousand four hundred and one.

unnormalised: So, double-check with your bank. Update your beneficiary details if needed. And for goodness’ sake, don’t just assume your old NEFT info is still good. Especially if you bank with HDFC (with all those HDFC000 branches, you know?!). The deadline is reportedly 31/12/2024 so don't say we didn't warn you!
normalised: So, double-check with your bank. Update your beneficiary details if needed. And for goodness' sake, don't just assume your old N-E-F-T info is still good. Especially if you bank with H-D-F-C (with all those H-D-F-C zero zero zero branches, you know?!). The deadline is reportedly thirty first december two thousand and twenty four so don't say we didn't warn you!
